title: Neoadjuvant toripalimab plus CapeOX in patients with locally advanced EBV-positive gastric or esophagogastric junction adenocarcinoma (GC/EGJC): Results from the phase II NICE trial.
indication: locally advanced EBV-positive gastric or esophagogastric junction adenocarcinoma (GC/EGJC)
treatment_arm: toripalimab (240 mg) combined with standard-dose CapeOX every 3 weeks for 4 cycles preoperatively and 4 cycles postoperatively
study_population: patients with locally advanced EBV-positive gastric or esophagogastric junction adenocarcinoma (GC/EGJC) with clinical tumor stages of cT3-4aNxM0 or cT2N+M0 disease as determined by both imaging scan and staging laparoscopy with negative peritoneal cytology.
study_size: Enrolled n=17; analysis set n=16 for resection/MPR/pCR and n=17 for safety; data cut-off Dec 31 2024.

title: A phase I clinical trial on combined (neo-)adjuvant intravenous plus intracranial administration of ipilimumab and nivolumab in recurrent glioblastoma (NEO-GLITIPNI).
indication: recurrent glioblastoma (rGBM)
treatment_arm: 2 NEOADJ cycles of IV IPI 1 mg/kg + NIVO 3 mg/kg followed by maximal safe resection (MSR) in week 5 with iCer admin of IPI 5 mg + NIVO 10 mg and iCav admin of IPI 1 mg + NIVO 10 mg. The adjuvant phase consists of biweekly postoperative iCav admin of IPI 1 mg + NIVO 10 mg and IV NIVO 240 mg for 12 cycles, followed by monthly NIVO 480 mg IV maintenance for up to two years.
study_population: patients (pts) with resectable rGBM (WHO grade 4, IDH wild type) who progressed after radiotherapy and temozolomide, with a baseline ECOG performance status of 0-2 and ≤8 mg methylprednisolone daily
study_size: A total of n=5 patients were enrolled, with a median follow-up of 15 weeks.

title: Osimertinib plus repotrectinib phase I trial in TKI-resistant non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) with EGFR mutations.
indication: TKI-resistant non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) with EGFR mutations
mechanism_of_action: inhibit Src/FAK/JAK2, in addition to ALK, ROS1 and NTRKs
treatment_arm: osimertinib 80mg QD plus repotrectinib in escalating doses: 80mg QD, 160mg QD and 160mg BID.
study_population: EGFR-mutant patients resistant to previous lines of treatment, with a median age of 61 years, 60% with PS1, and 48.7% with brain metastasis. The population included treatment-naive patients, osimertinib progressors, and patients who had received two or more previous lines of treatment.
study_size: Phase Ia included 15 patients, and Part Ib enrolled 15 patients.
line_of_therapy: resistant to previous lines of treatment

title: Efficacy and safety of alectinib in pediatric and adult patients with ALK altered advanced solid tumors: Results from the TACKLE phase II trial, a MASTER KEY substudy (NCCH1712/MK003).
indication: ALK altered advanced solid tumors
mechanism_of_action: tyrosine kinase inhibitor that targets anaplastic lymphoma kinase (ALK)
treatment_arm: alectinib as either a capsule or a suspension
study_population: Pediatric and adult patients (aged 8 months to 78 years) with ALK altered (fusion/rearrangements, mutations, or amplifications) locally advanced or metastatic cancer across 11 tumor types.
study_size: A total of n=26 patients were treated (main cohort evaluable n=16, all evaluable n=24); median follow-up was 15.0 mo.

title: De-escalated neoadjuvant taxane plus trastuzumab and pertuzumab with or without carboplatin in HER2-positive early breast cancer (neoCARHP): A multicentre, open-label, randomised, phase 3 trial.
indication: HER2-positive early breast cancer
control_arm: six 3-week cycles of an investigator-selected taxane (docetaxel, paclitaxel or nab-paclitaxel) plus trastuzumab (8 mg/kg loading dose, then 6 mg/kg every 3 weeks) and pertuzumab (840 mg loading dose, then 420 mg every 3 weeks), with carboplatin (TCbHP; AUC 6 mg/mL per min)
treatment_arm: six 3-week cycles of an investigator-selected taxane (docetaxel, paclitaxel or nab-paclitaxel) plus trastuzumab (8 mg/kg loading dose, then 6 mg/kg every 3 weeks) and pertuzumab (840 mg loading dose, then 420 mg every 3 weeks)
study_population: Eligible patients were ≥18 years old with untreated, stage II-III, invasive HER2-positive breast cancer.
study_size: A total of 774 patients were randomized (n=387 per group) from 15 hospitals, with 766 included in the mITT population (n=382 in THP and n=384 in TCbHP); adjuvant phase follow-up is ongoing.
comparator: taxane plus trastuzumab and pertuzumab with carboplatin (TCbHP)
trial_design_and_comparator: randomized; taxane + carboplatin + dual HER2 blockade

title: Safety, efficacy, and biomarker analysis from a phase II trial of intensive chemotherapy combined with serplulimab and trastuzumab in patients with advanced HER2-positive gastric cancer.
indication: unresectable locally advanced or metastatic HER2-positive gastric cancer
treatment_arm: Serplulimab (4.5 mg/kg, D1, Q3W), Trastuzumab (initial 8 mg/kg, D1, then 6 mg/kg, D1, Q3W), and the DOS regimen: oxaliplatin (100 mg/m², IV), docetaxel (40 mg/m², IV), and S-1 (40-60mg, BID, D1-14, Q3W). Chemotherapy is up to 8 cycles. Serplulimab and Trastuzumab can be administered until tumor progression.
study_population: patients (pts) with unresectable locally advanced or metastatic HER2-positive gastric cancer
study_size: Total recruited n=40 (efficacy-evaluable n=37) from 5 centers in China; median follow-up 7.9 mo.

title: Neoadjuvant (neoadj) osimertinib (osi) ± chemotherapy (CT) vs CT alone in resectable (R) epidermal growth factor receptor-mutated (EGFRm) NSCLC: NeoADAURA.
indication: resectable (R) epidermal growth factor-mutated (EGFRm) stage II–IIIB NSCLC
control_arm: placebo (PBO) QD + CT (cis/carboplatin + pemetrexed; 3 cycles, Q3W)
treatment_arm: neoadj osi 80 mg QD (≥9 wks) + CT (cis/carboplatin + pemetrexed; 3 cycles, Q3W)
study_population: Eligible pts: aged ≥18 yrs; WHO PS ≤1; EGFRm (Ex19del/L858R) stg II–IIIB (AJCC 8th ed) R-NSCLC.
study_size: Overall, 358 pts were randomized: osi + CT n=121, osi mono n=117, PBO + CT n=120; data cut-off: Oct 15, 2024; median EFS follow-up was 16 mo (osi+CT), 18 mo (osi mono), and 19 mo (PBO+CT).

title: A phase 1 study of KITE-363 anti-CD19/CD20 chimeric antigen receptor (CAR) T-cell therapy in patients (pts) with relapsed/refractory (R/R) B-cell lymphoma (BCL).
indication: relapsed/refractory (R/R) B-cell lymphoma (BCL)
mechanism_of_action: KITE-363 is a bicistronic, autologous CAR T-cell therapy that can potentially prevent CD19 escape through upfront dual targeting of CD19 and CD20.
treatment_arm: After lymphodepleting chemotherapy, pts received KITE-363 at dose levels (DLs) 1, 2, or 3 (0.5×10^6, 1×10^6, or 2×10^6 CAR T cells/kg, respectively).
study_population: Eligible adults had LBCL, indolent NHL, nodular lymphocyte-predominant Hodgkin lymphoma (NLPHL), or mediastinal gray zone lymphoma R/R after ≥2 lines of therapy (LoT). Pts with LBCL may have had primary refractory disease after ≥1 LoT.
study_size: As of 10/14/2024, 41 pts were enrolled and 37 received KITE-363 (n=34 with LBCL), with a median follow-up of 7.3 mo.

title: Efficacy and safety of nivolumab plus ipilimumab for patients with pre-treated type B3 thymoma and thymic carcinoma: Results from the EORTC-ETOP NIVOTHYM phase II trial.
indication: advanced/relapsed type B3 thymoma or thymic carcinoma (TC)
treatment_arm: N 240 mg Q2W and I 1mg/kg Q6W
study_population: patients ≥18yo, with advanced/relapsed type B3 thymoma or thymic carcinoma (TC), after previous exposure to platinum-based chemotherapy.
study_size: Enrolled n=56 in 15 centers/5 countries; median follow-up 16.0 mo.
line_of_therapy: after previous exposure to platinum-based chemotherapy

title: Safety and efficacy of anti-CEA CAR-T cells to prolong relapse-free survival of colorectal cancer liver metastases patients after radical resection.
indication: prolong relapse-free survival of colorectal cancer liver metastases patients after radical resection
mechanism_of_action: Specific chimeric antigen receptor (CAR) T-cell therapy... Carcinoembryonic antigen (CEA) is a glycoprotein which is highly expressed in colorectal tumor.
treatment_arm: Three dose levels of 1, 3, and 6 (10^6/kg) Anti-CEA CAR-T cells were administered in a dose-escalating manner.
study_population: colorectal cancer liver metastasis patients after radical resection... achieving no evidence of disease status after treatment and had CEA positivity of 30% or greater.
study_size: 48 subjects were screened, and 12 received CAR-T cell infusion (n=2 in the 1x10^6/kg group, n=2 in the 3×10^6/kg group, and n=8 in the 6×10^6/kg group); the median follow-up time for 9 pre-infusion relapse-free subjects was 23 mo.

title: Pilot study evaluating the addition of cemiplimab in BRAF-mutant anaplastic thyroid cancer after progression on dabrafenib and trametinib.
indication: BRAF-mutant anaplastic thyroid cancer after progression on dabrafenib and trametinib
treatment_arm: Cemiplimab (Cemi) was added to dabrafenib and trametinib (DT) after any tumor growth on DT.
study_population: Single institution pilot study of patients with BRAFm ATC where Cemi was added to DT after any tumor growth on DT (RECIST progression not required). Inclusion criteria included RECIST 1.1 measurable disease and no contraindication to immunotherapy.
study_size: n=12 patients received at least one dose of Cemi; data cut-off was 1/15/2025.
line_of_therapy: after progression on dabrafenib and trametinib

title: Nimotuzumab combined with chemotherapy in the first-line treatment for patients with stage IVB, recurrent or persistent cervical squamous cell carcinoma: A multi-center, randomized, double-blind, and controlled study.
indication: first-line treatment for patients with stage IVB, recurrent or persistent cervical squamous cell carcinoma
mechanism_of_action: EGFR (epidermal growth factor receptor) antibody, 95% humanization degree
treatment_arm: nimo+chemotherapy
study_population: patients with stage IVB, recurrent or persistent cervical squamous cell carcinoma
study_size: A total of 118 patients were enrolled: n=55 in the experimental group (nimo+chemotherapy) and n=63 in the control group (chemotherapy alone).

title: ONITT: A phase I study of nanoliposomal irinotecan with talazoparib or temozolomide in children and young adults with recurrent or refractory solid tumors.
indication: recurrent or refractory solid tumors
treatment_arm: The study evaluated two combinations in separate arms: Arm A consisted of nal-IRI (IV, dose escalated) plus talazoparib (po, 600mcg/m2/dose). Arm B consisted of nal-IRI (IV, dose escalated) plus temozolomide (po, 100mg/m2).
study_population: Patients (pts) aged 1-30 with recurrent or refractory solid tumors.
study_size: Forty-six pts enrolled at 5 sites; 37 pts (Arm A n=19, Arm B n=18) were enrolled after a protocol amendment.

title: Induction cadonilimab combined with chemotherapy followed by chemoradiotherapy for locally advanced cervical cancer: A multicenter, single-arm, phase II trial.
indication: locally advanced cervical cancer (LACC)
mechanism_of_action: a bi-specific antibody targeting both PD-1 and CTLA-4
treatment_arm: 2 cycles of induction therapy consisting of cadonilimab at a dose of 10mg/kg plus nab-paclitaxel at a dose of 260 mg/m² and cisplatin at a dose of 75mg/m² followed by CCRT
study_population: Eligible patients were women aged 18 years or older, newly diagnosed disease with stage IB3-IVA (International Federation of Gynecology and Obstetrics [FIGO] 2018), with histologically confirmed cervical carcinoma, and had an ECOG performance status of 0 or 1.
study_size: Total enrolled n=29 (planned n=29, including n=9 in stage 1), with 26 patients having completed CCRT by the data cut-off of January 19, 2025.
line_of_therapy: Induction therapy for newly diagnosed disease

title: Phase 2 study of axitinib + nivolumab in mucosal melanoma with pilot addition of stereotactic body radiotherapy or ipilimumab in select progressors.
indication: untreated, unresectable or advanced Mucosal melanoma (MM)
treatment_arm: nivolumab (nivo) plus axitinib (axi) 5mg PO twice daily
study_population: patients (pts) with untreated, unresectable or advanced Mucosal melanoma (MM).
study_size: N=21 pts were enrolled, n=20 were evaluable for efficacy; doublet arm n=21, triplet arm n=7 (n=5 ipi, n=2 SBRT); median follow up was 15 mos.

title: Efficacy and toxicity of nivolumab and ipilimumab in rare cancer brain metastases: A multi-center basket trial analysis (NCI/SWOG S1609).
indication: rare cancer brain metastases
treatment_arm: nivolumab (NIVO, 240 mg Q2W) and ipilimumab (IPI, 1 mg/kg Q6W)
study_population: patients with brain metastases (BM) from rare cancers
study_size: Total evaluable patients n=684 in the basket trial; analysis compares patients without BM (n=707) and with BM at enrollment (n=20); trial conducted across >1000 sites.

title: WaveLINE-003: Phase 2/3 trial of zilovertamab vedotin plus standard of care in relapsed/refractory diffuse large B-cell lymphoma.
indication: relapsed/refractory (R/R) diffuse large B cell lymphoma (DLBCL)
treatment_arm: ZV (1.5, 1.75, or 2.0 mg/kg) plus R-GemOx Q3W for ≥6 cycles
study_population: adult participants (pts) with confirmed R/R DLBCL after ≥1 lines of therapy (LOT) who were ineligible for chimeric antigen receptor T-cell therapy (CAR-T), autologous stem-cell transplant (ASCT), or failed such therapies (cohort A).
study_size: A total of 40 pts were enrolled in cohort A to receive R-GemOx plus ZV 1.5 mg/kg (n=17), 1.75 mg/kg (n=16), or 2.0 mg/kg (n=7); data cut-off was August 1, 2024; median follow-up was 9.8 mo.

title: FIRE-4 (AIO KRK-0114): Randomized study evaluating the efficacy of cetuximab re-challenge in patients with metastatic RAS wild-type colorectal cancer responding to first-line treatment with FOLFIRI plus cetuximab.
indication: metastatic RAS wild-type colorectal cancer (mCRC)
treatment_arm: (FOLF)IRI plus cetuximab
study_population: RAS wild-type (RAS WT) metastatic colorectal cancer (mCRC) pts, who had responded to cetuximab-based induction therapy within FIRE-4 (entry 1) or outside of the study (entry 2).
study_size: A total of 672 patients were randomized in the first randomization and 657 were assigned to treatment across 120 German and 10 Austrian centers; within the second randomization, 87 patients were attributed to physician’s choice (n=42) or (FOLF)IRI plus cetuximab (n=45).
line_of_therapy: Re-challenge after first-line treatment and second progression

title: NRG-BR003: A randomized phase III trial comparing doxorubicin plus cyclophosphamide followed by weekly paclitaxel with or without carboplatin for node-positive or high-risk node-negative TNBC.
indication: adjuvant therapy of node-positive or high-risk node-negative TNBC
control_arm: dose-dense (DD) AC every 2 weeks for 4 cycles followed by weekly P (80 mg/m2) for 12 doses
treatment_arm: dose-dense (DD) AC every 2 weeks for 4 cycles followed by weekly P (80 mg/m2) for 12 doses with carbo AUC of 5 IV every 3 weeks for 4 cycles
study_population: patients (pts) with operable node-positive or high-risk node-negative triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC)
study_size: 769 pts were randomized to control arm (n=385) and carbo arm (n=384); at data cutoff (2/28/25), median follow-up was 79.4 mos.

title: Myeloablative fractionated busulfan conditioning regimen with sorafenib for allogeneic stem cell transplant in AML: Results of a phase 1/2 study.
indication: AML patients for allogeneic stem cell transplant (allo-SCT)
treatment_arm: Sorafenib (up to 800mg) given daily on days -24 to -5, added to a myeloablative conditioning regimen of fludarabine (Flu 40mg/m2 on days -6 to -3) and fractionated busulfan (f-Bu). GVHD prophylaxis was cyclophosphamide 50mg/kg on days 3-4 and tacrolimus, with MMF for unrelated donor graft recipients. Eligible patients could receive sorafenib maintenance for 1 year post-transplant.
study_population: 59 AML patients aged 18-70 years with 8/8-HLA matched donors. Disease status at SCT was CR1 (71%), CRi (10%), or advanced disease (19%). 58% had ELN22 adverse risk disease, 53% were MRD+, and 29% had FLT3 ITD.
study_size: A total of n=59 AML patients were enrolled, with n=3 patients at 200mg, n=3 at 400mg, n=3 at 600mg, and n=50 at 800mg sorafenib; median follow-up in 43 surviving patients was 2.2 years.

title: A phase 2 study of novel MDM2 inhibitor alrizomadlin (APG-115) with or without toripalimab in patients (pts) with advanced adenoid cystic carcinoma (ACC) or other solid tumors.
indication: advanced adenoid cystic carcinoma (ACC) or other solid tumors
control_arm: Alrizomadlin was administered orally at 50, 100, or 150 mg every other day for 2 weeks, with 1 week off, in repeated 21-day cycles.
treatment_arm: alrizomadlin at 50, 100, or 150 mg orally every other day for 2 weeks, with 1 week off, in repeated 21-day cycles, combined with toripalimab 240 mg IV for 30 minutes on Day 1 of repeated 21-day cycles
study_population: pts with advanced ACC, malignant peripheral nerve sheath tumor (MPNST), LPS, biliary-tract cancer (BTC), or other solid tumors in China. Enrolled pts had an ECOG PS 0-1 and were without central nervous system metastases.
study_size: Total enrolled n=54 (monotherapy arm n=22, combination arm n=32); evaluable n=14 (monotherapy) and n=28 (combination); study conducted in China; data cutoff was January 5, 2025.

title: A phase II (Alliance/A091802) randomized trial of avelumab plus cetuximab vs. avelumab alone in advanced cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma (cSCC).
indication: advanced cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma (cSCC)
mechanism_of_action: IgG1 mAb therapy targeting EGFR and PD-1:PD-(L)1 blockade
control_arm: avelumab (AV) alone every 2 weeks for up to 2 years (yrs)
treatment_arm: avelumab (AV) (800 mg) plus cetuximab (C) (500 mg/m2) every 2 weeks for up to 2 years (yrs). C was given for 1 yr in the AV+C arm.
study_population: Eligible patients (pts) had distant metastatic or unresectable locally advanced cSCC, anti-PD-1/PD-L1 mAb naive, no prior cetuximab in the advanced setting, ECOG PS 0-2, HIV+ if CD4 >200 and VL <200.
study_size: A total of n=60 patients were enrolled, with n=57 evaluable. Data cutoff was 1/16/25.

title: Phase II study of short-course radiotherapy (SCRT) followed by consolidation chemotherapy with FOLFOXIRI as total neoadjuvant therapy (TNT) for locally advanced rectal cancer (LARC) patients (pts): The ShorTrip study.
indication: locally advanced rectal cancer (LARC)
treatment_arm: short-course radiotherapy (SCRT) followed by one cycle of FOLFOX and 7 cycles of FOLFOXIRI
study_population: Pts ≤70 years with medium-high (5-10 cm from the anal verge) LARC with at least one of the following features: cT4, cN2, involved mesorectal fascia (MRF+) or cT3N+.
study_size: Enrolled n=64 in 9 centres; n=63 were resected and evaluated for pathological response.

title: A phase II study of prophylactic thrombopoietin combined with magnetic resonance guided hematopoietical bone marrow-sparing intensity-modulated radiotherapy and concurrent chemotherapy for thoracic esophageal cancer.
indication: thoracic esophageal cancer (EC) patients treated with concurrent chemoradiotherapy (CRT)
treatment_arm: BM-sparing intensity modulated radiotherapy (BMS-IMRT) (≥45Gy) and concurrent chemotherapy (five cycles of weekly intravenous paclitaxel [50 mg/m²] and cisplatin/nedaplatin [25 mg/m²], or two cycles of intravenous paclitaxel [135-175 mg/m²] and cisplatin [80 mg/m²]), and rhTPO (15000U ih. qw during the radiotherapy).
study_population: Thoracic EC patients staged I-IVa (AJCC 7th).
study_size: Planned n=23, screened n=32, enrolled n=27; data from July 20 2023 to June 30 2024.

title: Single low-dose 5-mg versus 8-mg dexamethasone with NEPA for the 168-h prevention of highly or moderately emetogenic (high-risk patients) chemotherapy-induced nausea/vomiting: An open-label, randomised, controlled, phase 3 trial.
indication: prevention of highly or moderately emetogenic (high-risk patients) chemotherapy-induced nausea/vomiting (CINV)
control_arm: 8 mg DEX treatment arm with NEPA
treatment_arm: 5 mg DEX treatment arm with NEPA
study_population: patients receiving highly or moderately emetogenic (high-risk patients) chemotherapy
study_size: Total randomized n=164 assigned to 5 mg or 8 mg DEX treatment arms.

title: Neoadjuvant lenvatinib plus pembrolizumab for resectable clear-cell renal cell carcinoma (PELUR): A prospective phase 2 study.
indication: resectable clear-cell renal cell carcinoma (ccRCC)
treatment_arm: neoadjuvant low-dose lenvatinib plus pembrolizumab (ldLP) every 21 days for 3 cycles
study_population: patients with resectable high-risk ccRCC
study_size: Enrolled n=33, ITT n=23; median follow-up 22 mo.

title: Phase 1a dose-escalation study of RS-0139: A novel tumor-targeted nanomedicine for advanced solid tumors.
indication: advanced solid tumors
mechanism_of_action: RS-0139 is a tumor-targeted prodrug designed to enhance the therapeutic index of docetaxel (DTX) by selectively delivering the active agent to tumor tissues. DTX is covalently bound to a polymer backbone, together with a targeting peptide, which shows a high affinity to αvβ3, αvβ5 and αvβ6 integrin receptors highly overexpressed on the tumor cell surface. Once RS-0139 is up-taken by the cell, the covalent bond is cleaved to release DTX.
target: αvβ3, αvβ5 and αvβ6 integrin receptors
treatment_arm: single dose of RS-0139 intravenously using an accelerated titration design. Dose levels (DL) included 60, 75, and 100 mg/m².
study_population: Eligiblepatients (18-75 years) with recurrent, locally advanced, or metastatic solid tumors and ECOG PS 0-1.
study_size: Eight patients (n=8) were enrolled across three dose levels (DL 1: 75 mg/m², n=3; DL 2: 100 mg/m², n=2; DL -1: 60 mg/m², n=3).

title: Positron emission tomography with computed tomography (PET/CT) and minimal residual disease (MRD) for efficacy assessment in transplant-ineligible newly diagnosed myeloma (Ti NDMM) patients (pts): IMROZ analysis.
indication: transplant-ineligible newly diagnosed myeloma (Ti NDMM)
control_arm: VRd (bortezomib, lenalidomide and dexamethasone) as initiation, then Rd (lenalidomide and dexamethasone) as maintenance.
treatment_arm: Isa-VRd (Isatuximab plus bortezomib, lenalidomide and dexamethasone) as initiation, then Isa-Rd (Isatuximab plus lenalidomide and dexamethasone) as maintenance.
study_population: transplant-ineligible newly diagnosed myeloma (Ti NDMM) patients (pts)
study_size: Across the global and China populations, 244 Isa-VRd and 162 VRd pts had PET/CT at baseline; a sub-analysis of patients with plasmacytoma included n=77 for Isa-VRd and n=52 for VRd.

title: Intensified hormonal blockade with SBRT in PSMA-PET detected oligometastatic prostate adenocarcinoma: Results from the phase II Metacure trial cohorts B2 and the B2 expansion.
indication: PSMA-PET detected metachronous oligometastatic hormone-sensitive prostate cancer (HSPC)
control_arm: metastasis-directed SBRT with 10 months of ADT + apalutamide (ADT+APA)
treatment_arm: metastasis-directed SBRT with 10 months of ADT + apalutamide + abiraterone acetate plus prednisone (ADT+APA+AAP)
study_population: patients (pts) with PSMA-PET detected metachronous oligometastatic HSPC. Eligible pts had biochemical recurrence or persistence (PSA >0.2) after prostatectomy with metastases treatable within max 3 RT plans.
study_size: A total of 36 pts were treated in the combined B2 (n=10) and B2 expansion (n=26) cohorts; median follow-up was 35 months for cohort B2 and 19 months for the B2 expansion.

title: A single-center, prospective, randomized controlled trial of tislelizumab combined with platinum-containing chemotherapy as first-line treatment for HIV-positive patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer.
indication: first-line treatment for HIV-positive patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer
control_arm: HIV-negative patients receiving tislelizumab combined with platinum-containing chemotherapy (paclitaxel or nab-paclitaxel or pemetrexed combined with cisplatin or carboplatin) for 4-6 cycles, followed by maintenance therapy with tislelizumab.
treatment_arm: HIV-positive patients receiving tislelizumab combined with platinum-containing chemotherapy (paclitaxel or nab-paclitaxel or pemetrexed combined with cisplatin or carboplatin) for 4-6 cycles, followed by maintenance therapy with tislelizumab.
study_population: stage IIIC-IV NSCLC patients... divided into HIV-positive and HIV-negative groups based on whether they had HIV infection.
study_size: n=54 enrolled (n=17 HIV-positive, n=37 HIV-negative); median follow-up 7.3 mo (HIV-positive) and 13.4 mo (HIV-negative).
comparator: HIV-negative patients with advanced NSCLC receiving the same treatment regimen.

title: First survival outcomes and biomarker results of SURE-01: Neoadjuvant sacituzumab govitecan (SG) monotherapy, followed by radical cystectomy (RC), in patients with muscle-invasive urothelial bladder cancer (MIBC).
indication: Neoadjuvant sacituzumab govitecan (SG) monotherapy... in patients with muscle-invasive urothelial bladder cancer (MIBC)
mechanism_of_action: antibody-drug conjugate composed of an anti-trophoblast cell surface antigen 2 (Trop-2) antibody coupled to SN-38 (a topoisomerase-I inhibitor)
treatment_arm: 4 cycles of SG 7.5 mg/kg intravenously (reduced dose in protocol amendment 1) on days 1 and 8, Q3W, followed by RC
study_population: Pts age ≥18 y, ECOG PS 0-1, with histologically confirmed cT2-T4N0M0 MIBC, ineligible/refusing NAC and scheduled for RC
study_size: enrolled n=37, efficacy-evaluable n=33; median follow-up 14 mo (range 10-17).

title: Phase Ib study of the combination of regorafenib with conventional chemotherapy in patients with newly diagnosed multi-metastatic Ewing sarcoma: The Rego-Inter-Ewing-1 study.
indication: newly diagnosed multi-metastatic Ewing sarcoma
treatment_arm: Regorafenib given orally for 21 days of a 28-day cycle (from day 5) at dose levels from 50 mg/m²/day to 82 mg/m²/day, in combination with standard interval-compressed chemotherapy (VDC/IE).
study_population: patients aged 2-50 years with newly diagnosed metastatic (excluding lung/pleura only) Ewing sarcoma
study_size: Thirteen patients (DL0: n=2, DL1: n=11) were enrolled out of a planned maximum of 24 patients across 7 centres and 3 countries, with a data cut-off of 21/01/2025.

title: First-line (1L) datopotamab deruxtecan (Dato-DXd) + rilvegostomig in advanced or metastatic non-small cell lung cancer (a/mNSCLC): Results from TROPION-Lung04 (cohort 5).
indication: First-line (1L) advanced or metastatic non-small cell lung cancer (a/mNSCLC) without actionable genomic alterations (AGAs)
mechanism_of_action: Dato-DXd, a TROP2-directed antibody-drug conjugate... Rilvegostomig, a bispecific antibody targeting PD-1 and TIGIT
treatment_arm: Dato-DXd (6 mg/kg) + rilvegostomig IV Q3W
study_population: treatment-naïve pts with a/mNSCLC without actionable genomic alterations (AGAs)
study_size: A total of n=40 patients were treated (C5a, n=20; C5b, n=20), with 20 (50.0%) still on any study treatment at the 24 Oct, 2024 data cut-off; median treatment duration was 5.1 mo.

title: Phase 2 study of nivolumab for patients with meningiomas refractory to surgery and radiotherapy with immune-related response criteria.
indication: meningiomas refractory to surgery and radiotherapy
treatment_arm: Nivolumab (480 mg) was administered intravenously every 4 weeks and continued until tumor progression or unacceptable toxicity for up to 365 days.
study_population: patients with meningiomas (grade I, II, or III) refractory to surgery and radiotherapy
study_size: Planned n=29 (required n=27); total n=29 started therapy; response-evaluable n=28.

title: Randomized trial of standard chemotherapy alone or combined with atezolizumab as adjuvant therapy for patients with stage III deficient DNA mismatch repair (dMMR) colon cancer (Alliance A021502; ATOMIC).
indication: adjuvant therapy for patients with stage III deficient DNA mismatch repair (dMMR) colon cancer
treatment_arm: mFOLFOX6 plus atezo (840 mg IV q2 weeks) for 12 cycles (6 months)[mo] followed by atezo monotherapy for 13 cycles (12 mo total)
study_population: patients (pts) with surgically resected stage III dMMR colon adenocarcinoma (any T, N1,2 M0), age > 12 years (yr)
study_size: A total of 712 patients were randomized to the atezo plus mFOLFOX6 arm (n=355) or the mFOLFOX6 arm (n=357) out of a planned 700, with a median follow-up of 37.2 mo.

title: Aspirin as secondary prevention for colorectal cancer liver metastases (ASAC): A multicenter, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, phase 3 trial.
indication: secondary prevention for colorectal cancer liver metastases
mechanism_of_action: aspirin may have antineoplastic effects in colon cancer
control_arm: placebo once daily for 3 years or until disease recurrence
treatment_arm: aspirin 160 mg once daily for 3 years or until disease recurrence
study_population: Patients (aged ≥18 years old) radically treated for colorectal cancer liver metastases.
study_size: A total of 466 patients were randomly assigned (aspirin, n=234; placebo, n=232), with 428 patients included in the full analysis set (aspirin, n=217; placebo, n=211) across 14 centers in 3 countries.

title: Long-term results of the randomized, phase 3 KEYNOTE-412 trial of pembrolizumab (pembro) or placebo (pbo) plus concurrent chemoradiotherapy (CRT) for unresected, locally advanced head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (LA HNSCC).
indication: unresected, locally advanced head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (LA HNSCC)
control_arm: pbo IV Q3W + CRT (70 Gy in 35 fractions + 3 cycles cisplatin 100 mg/m2 Q3W)
treatment_arm: 17 cycles of pembro 200 mg IV Q3W + CRT (70 Gy in 35 fractions + 3 cycles cisplatin 100 mg/m2 Q3W)
study_population: Adults with newly diagnosed high-risk unresected LA HNSCC (any T3-T4 [N0-N3] or any N2a-3 [T1-T4] larynx/hypopharynx/oral cavity/p16-negative oropharynx cancers and T4 or N3 p16-positive oropharynx cancer)
study_size: 402 pts were assigned to each arm (pembro + CRT, n=402; pbo + CRT, n=402); 398 received ≥1 dose of study treatment in each arm. Data cutoff was August 21, 2024, with a median study follow-up of 74.4 mo.

title: Results of BH011 after intravesical administration in patients with CIS and/or papillary non-muscle invasive bladder cancer (NMIBC) after BCG failure: Interim results from a phase I/II clinical trial.
indication: high risk NMIBC (HR NMIBC) after BCG failure
mechanism_of_action: BH011 is a novel docetaxel formulation for intravesical administration that significantly increased the concentration of free docetaxel and bladder tissue permeability compared to TAXOTERE, which may result in a more efficient and effective tumor response.
treatment_arm: BH011 17.5mg administered intravesically on day 1, once a week for 6 weeks during the induction treatment and once a month for 12 months during the maintenance treatment.
study_population: BCG failure (including refractory, recurrence, non-responsive, and intolerant) HR NMIBC pts.
study_size: A total of 25 patients were treated (n=7 with CIS, n=18 with papillary tumors), with 24 evaluable for efficacy; median RFS was 20.21 mo.

title: Results of a phase II trial of olaparib in combination with ceralasertib in patients with recurrent and unresectable osteosarcoma.
indication: recurrent and unresectable osteosarcoma
treatment_arm: Olaparib 150mg twice a day on days 1-28 and ceralasertib 80mg twice a day on days 1-14 of a 28-day cycle.
study_population: Patients aged 12-40 weighing > 40 Kg with recurrent osteosarcoma and measurable unresectable disease, who had received an average of 4.2 prior therapy regimens.
study_size: Planned n=34 evaluable patients for Cohort 1; enrolled n=38 from four centers; evaluable for safety/response/survival n=37; evaluable for primary objective n=33; data cut-off 1/21/2025.

title: Adjuvant icotinib of 12 months versus observation as adjuvant therapy for completely resected EGFR-mutated stage IB non-small-cell lung cancer: 5-year update from CORIN (GASTO1003).
indication: adjuvant therapy for completely resected EGFR-mutated stage IB non-small-cell lung cancer (NSCLC)
treatment_arm: icotinib (125mg, three times daily, 12 months)
study_population: patients with completely resected, EGFR-mutated, stage IB (7th TNM staging) NSCLC without adjuvant chemotherapy
study_size: enrolled n=128 (icotinib n=63; observation n=65); data cut-off December 20 2024; median follow-up 65.0 mo.

title: A phase I/II study of abemaciclib, a CDK4/6 inhibitor, in participants with HIV-associated and HIV-negative Kaposi sarcoma.
indication: HIV-associated and HIV-negative Kaposi sarcoma
mechanism_of_action: oral cyclin-dependent kinase (CDK) inhibitor that targets CDK4 (cyclin D1) and CDK6 (cyclin D3)
treatment_arm: abemaciclib 200mg twice daily for days 1-28 of a 28-day cycle, with intra-participant dose reductions permissible for abema-related toxicities.
study_population: participants (pts) with HIV-associated and HIV-negative Kaposi sarcoma with a median age of 43 years; eligibility included adherence to antiretroviral therapy in people with HIV (PWH) for > 8 weeks prior to enrollment and no concomitant strong CYP3A4 inhibitors.
study_size: A total of n=34 participants were enrolled, including n=6 in Phase I and n=28 in Phase II (n=17 in Arm 1, n=11 in Arm 2), with n=31 evaluable for response.

title: Efficacy and safety of second-line therapy with serplulimab, lenvatinib, and paclitaxel in patients with gastric or gastroesophageal junction adenocarcinoma (GC/GEJC) for whom immunochemotherapy failed: A multicenter, single-arm, phase II trial (STILL).
indication: second-line therapy in patients with gastric or gastroesophageal junction adenocarcinoma (GC/GEJC) for whom immunochemotherapy failed
treatment_arm: serplulimab (300 mg), lenvatinib (8 mg QD), and paclitaxel 135-175 mg/m² or nab-paclitaxel 260 mg/m², every 3 weeks for six cycles, followed by maintenance therapy with serplulimab and lenvatinib
study_population: Eligible GC/GEJC patients for whom first-line treatments of immunotherapy (IO) and chemotherapy failed, who met at least one of the following 3 criteria: 1) PD-L1 combined positive score (CPS) ≥1; 2) previous partial or complete response, or 3) progression-free survival (PFS) ≥6 months in first-line therapy.
study_size: Enrolled n=47 from 8 centers; response-evaluable n=41; median follow-up 6.3 mo.

title: Preoperative PD-1 inhibitor (tislelizumab) plus SOX for locally advanced gastric or gastro-oesophageal junction cancer: Results from a single-arm, phase II trial.
indication: locally advanced gastric or gastro-oesophageal junction cancer
treatment_arm: three or four preoperative 3-week cycles of SOX plus PD-1 antibody tislelizumab, followed by D2 gastrectomy
study_population: Patients with resectable gastric or GEJ cancer clinically staged as cT3N+M0 or cT4NanyM0.
study_size: Enrolled n=31; efficacy and safety analysis set n=27.

title: Lower-dose versus standard-dose abiraterone in patients with metastatic castration resistant prostate cancer: A multicentric randomized phase III non-inferiority trial.
indication: metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer (mCRPC)
treatment_arm: lower-dose AbA (250 mg with a low-fat meal, Arm-A)
study_population: Patients with metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer (mCRPC), median age 65 years, ECOG-PS 1 in 68.3%, median of 1 prior treatment line, with 64.0% having received prior docetaxel.
study_size: The study recruited n=164 patients (Arm-A n=86; Arm-B n=78) out of a planned n=314, with a median follow-up of 18.1 months.

title: Phase 1b dose extension study of a next-generation anti-CD47 monoclonal antibody IMC-002 combined with lenvatinib in patients with advanced hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC).
indication: advanced hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC)
mechanism_of_action: next-generation anti-CD47 monoclonal antibody... attributed to its unique binding site and distinct mechanism of action.
treatment_arm: IMC-002 was administered at 20 mg/kg Q3W in combination with Lenvatinib, continuing until disease progression.
study_population: Eligible pts had advanced HCC that progressed following at least 1 prior systemic therapy and ECOG PS ≤1.
study_size: Total n=13; efficacy evaluable n=10.
line_of_therapy: post at least 1 prior systemic therapy

title: PRAGMATICA-LUNG (SWOG S2302): A prospective, randomized study of ramucirumab plus pembrolizumab versus standard of care for participants previously treated with immunotherapy for stage IV or recurrent non-small cell lung cancer.
indication: stage IV or recurrent non-small cell lung cancer
treatment_arm: ramucirumab plus pembrolizumab (RP)
study_population: Participants (n=838) with stage IV or recurrent non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) who previously received an immune checkpoint inhibitor (ICI) for at least 84 days and platinum-based therapy; median age 68, 29% squamous cell carcinoma, 63% adenocarcinoma, and performance status (PS) of 0-2 (13% PS2).
study_size: S2302 enrolled n=838 (n=419/arm); the second interim analysis was based on 370 deaths with a median follow-up for alive patients of 5.2 mos (data cutoff: April 2025).
line_of_therapy: Previously treated with ICI and platinum-based therapy

title: Multicenter phase I/II study of abemaciclib and ramucirumab in metastatic gastroesophageal adenocarcinoma (GEA): CDK4/6 and cyclin D1 alterations as a predictor of response and survival.
indication: metastatic gastroesophageal adenocarcinoma (GEA)
treatment_arm: abemaciclib (A) (150mg po bid) and ramucirumab (RAM) (8mg/kg iv every 2 weeks)
study_population: Pretreated advanced GEA (2nd or 3rd line) patients with a median age of 61.5 years, mostly male (18/20), ECOG performance status of 0 in 40%, and 55% having received prior immunotherapy with 1st line chemotherapy.
study_size: Enrolled n=20 (planned n=30); evaluable for biomarkers n=17.

title: A prospective, single-arm, phase II trial of adebrelimab plus nab-paclitaxel and carboplatin in patients with unresectable advanced metastatic or recurrent thymic carcinomas.
indication: unresectable advanced metastatic or recurrent thymic carcinomas
treatment_arm: adebrelimab (20 mg/kg) plus nab-paclitaxel (260 mg/m2) and carboplatin (AUC 5) every 3 weeks for up to 4-6 cycles, followed by adebrelimab (20 mg/kg) every 3 weeks for up to 2 years until progression or unacceptable toxicity
study_population: patients with unresectable UICC stage III or IV, recurrent, or metastatic TCs without any previous anti-tumor therapy
study_size: A total of n=18 patients were enrolled in the first stage and included in the efficacy and safety analysis, with a planned expansion to n=33; data cut-off was Dec 1, 2024.
